alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 5:44AM EST until January 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DC, including the following , District of Columbia and central Maryland, including the following county, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington... Rockville... Bethesda... Olney... Langley Park... Fort Totten... Aspen Hill... Potomac... North Bethesda... White Oak... Redland... Takoma Park... Adelphi... Colesville... Kemp Mill... Chevy Chase... North Kensington... South Kensington... Forest Glen... Hillandale... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Beach Dr from Broad Branch Rd to Piney Branch Pkwy, Connecticut Avenue just north of the Beltway, University Boulevard at Sligo Creek, Viers Mill Road at Rock Creek, Beach Drive along Rock Creek and Sligo Creek Parkway. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
